resources.string: A microG/UnifiedNlp location provider backend using private on phone RF emitter database
Write all data to a CSV file
Export is only supported on KitKat and above
Use Kalman filter for GPS location
Recommended for devices with bad GPS
When disabled, scans for cell towers will not happen
When disabled, WiFi scans will not happen
Enable GPS when unknown emitters are found (to fill up the database)
Low - Enable GPS only when emitters are found, but no location could be determined at all
Medium - Also enable GPS when WiFi emitters were found, but none of them could be used to determine a location
High - Like above, but require better GPS accuracy (to store 5 GHz WiFis)
Aggressive - Enable GPS when unknown emitters are found. Very likely to cause excessive battery drain
Active mode: GPS on. Scanning because of %s and %d others
Scans for emitters and displays result with additional information
Decide which emitters should be discarded in case of inconsistent locations

Default (used in Déjà Vu): only use the largest consistent group of emitters. This usually gives good accuracy, but occasionally produces wrong locations.

 Median: discard emitters that are unbelievably far from the median location: somewhat worse accuracy than default, but reduced chance of wrong locations.

 Use all emitters: sensitive to extreme outliers and often the least accurate of the three, but most likely to contain the actual location inside the accuracy circle.

 Often all 3 methods give (nearly) the same results, expect to see a difference only in some cases.

 Current setting: %s
Select CSV created from export, Déjà Vu / Local NLP Backend database or MLS / OpenCelliD csv list
How to handle emitters that already exist in local database?
Enter country codes (MCC) to import, comma separated. Use "x" as placeholder for digits 0–9. Leave blank to import all.
Scanning failed, maybe the backend service is disabled. Try disabling and enabling again.
This emitter is not in the database
Please enable Local NLP Backend again so it may ask for background location permission
Scan and insert emitters into database at this location?\n latitude: %1$.5f\n longitude: %2$.5f
